overview.description: This course provides a foundational understanding of AWS SageMaker, a powerful tool for building, training, and deploying machine learning models at scale. Participants will explore the various features and functionalities of SageMaker, including data preparation, model training, and deployment processes. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, learners will gain practical experience in utilizing SageMaker to streamline their machine learning workflows and enhance their capabilities as aspiring machine learning engineers.
overview.target_audience: This course is designed for beginners who are interested in machine learning and want to learn how to use AWS SageMaker to build and deploy machine learning models. It is suitable for individuals with little to no prior experience in machine learning or cloud computing, including students, professionals transitioning into data science, and anyone looking to enhance their technical skills in the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of machine learning concepts.
Basic knowledge of AWS services is beneficial but not required.

modules.title: Introduction to AWS SageMaker
modules.description: An overview of AWS SageMaker and its components.
module_outcomes: Understand the purpose of AWS SageMaker

lessons.title: What is AWS SageMaker?
lessons.summary: Learn about the purpose and functionalities of AWS SageMaker.

hands_on_labs.title: Exploring SageMaker Studio
hands_on_labs.goal: Navigate through the SageMaker Studio interface and understand its components.

micro_exercises.title: Identify SageMaker Features
micro_exercises.task: List at least three features of AWS SageMaker and explain their significance.

micro_exercises.title: Machine Learning Lifecycle
micro_exercises.task: Describe the stages of the machine learning lifecycle and how SageMaker fits into it.

knowledge_check.question: What is the primary purpose of AWS SageMaker?
knowledge_check.answer: To provide a fully managed service for building, training, and deploying machine learning models.

knowledge_check.question: Name one benefit of using cloud computing for machine learning.
knowledge_check.answer: Scalability and flexibility in resources.

objectives: Explain its importance in machine learning
common_mistakes: Confusing SageMaker with other AWS services
Underestimating the importance of data preparation

lessons.title: Navigating SageMaker Studio
lessons.summary: Learn how to navigate the SageMaker Studio interface and its components.

hands_on_labs.title: Creating Your First Notebook
hands_on_labs.goal: Create and run a Jupyter notebook in SageMaker Studio.

micro_exercises.title: Interface Exploration
micro_exercises.task: Explore the SageMaker Studio interface and identify at least five components.

micro_exercises.title: Notebook Creation
micro_exercises.task: Create a new Jupyter notebook and run a simple Python command.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of SageMaker Notebooks?
knowledge_check.answer: To provide an interactive environment for writing and executing code.

knowledge_check.question: How can you manage resources in SageMaker Studio?
knowledge_check.answer: By monitoring usage and adjusting instance types as needed.

lessons.title: Understanding Machine Learning Concepts
lessons.summary: Explore fundamental machine learning concepts relevant to SageMaker.

hands_on_labs.title: Algorithm Selection
hands_on_labs.goal: Select an appropriate algorithm for a given dataset and problem.

micro_exercises.title: Define Key Terms
micro_exercises.task: Define supervised learning and provide an example.

micro_exercises.title: Algorithm Identification
micro_exercises.task: Identify which algorithms are used for supervised learning.

knowledge_check.question: What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
knowledge_check.answer: Supervised learning uses labeled data, while unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data.

knowledge_check.question: Name a common algorithm used in supervised learning.
knowledge_check.answer: Linear regression or decision trees.

real_world_use_cases: Choosing the right algorithm for a problem

modules.title: Data Preparation in SageMaker
modules.description: Learn how to prepare data for machine learning using SageMaker.
module_outcomes: Use SageMaker tools for data preparation

lessons.title: Data Ingestion
lessons.summary: Learn how to ingest data into SageMaker from various sources.

hands_on_labs.title: Ingesting Data from S3
hands_on_labs.goal: Ingest a dataset from an S3 bucket into SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Data Sources
micro_exercises.task: List at least three different data sources that can be used in SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Ingestion Method
micro_exercises.task: Describe the steps to ingest data from an S3 bucket.

knowledge_check.question: What is a common data source for machine learning in SageMaker?
knowledge_check.answer: Amazon S3 buckets.

knowledge_check.question: Why is data format important when ingesting data?
knowledge_check.answer: Incompatible formats can lead to errors during processing.

lessons.title: Data Cleaning and Preprocessing
lessons.summary: Learn techniques for cleaning and preprocessing data in SageMaker.

hands_on_labs.title: Cleaning a Dataset
hands_on_labs.goal: Clean a provided dataset and prepare it for training.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Data Issues
micro_exercises.task: List common data issues that can affect model performance.

micro_exercises.title: Apply Cleaning Techniques
micro_exercises.task: Demonstrate how to handle missing values in a dataset.

knowledge_check.question: What is one common issue found in datasets?
knowledge_check.answer: Missing values.

knowledge_check.question: Why is feature scaling important?
knowledge_check.answer: It ensures that all features contribute equally to the model's performance.

lessons.title: Feature Engineering
lessons.summary: Learn how to create and select features for machine learning models.

hands_on_labs.title: Creating Features
hands_on_labs.goal: Create new features from existing data to improve model performance.

micro_exercises.title: Define Feature Engineering
micro_exercises.task: Explain what feature engineering is and why it is important.

micro_exercises.title: Feature Selection Techniques
micro_exercises.task: List and describe two techniques for feature selection.

knowledge_check.question: What is feature engineering?
knowledge_check.answer: The process of using domain knowledge to create features that make machine learning algorithms work.

knowledge_check.question: Name one technique for dimensionality reduction.
knowledge_check.answer: Principal Component Analysis (PCA).

common_mistakes: Overfitting by adding too many features

modules.title: Training Models in SageMaker
modules.description: Learn how to train machine learning models using SageMaker.

lessons.title: Using Built-in Algorithms
lessons.summary: Learn how to use SageMaker's built-in algorithms for model training.

hands_on_labs.title: Training a Model with XGBoost
hands_on_labs.goal: Train a classification model using the XGBoost algorithm.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Built-in Algorithms
micro_exercises.task: List at least three built-in algorithms available in SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Use Case Matching
micro_exercises.task: Match algorithms to their appropriate use cases.

knowledge_check.question: What is a built-in algorithm in SageMaker?
knowledge_check.answer: An algorithm provided by SageMaker that can be used for training without needing to code it from scratch.

knowledge_check.question: Why is hyperparameter tuning important?
knowledge_check.answer: It helps improve the model's performance by finding the best parameters.

objectives: Train a model using a built-in algorithm
common_mistakes: Choosing the wrong algorithm for the problem

lessons.title: Training Custom Models
lessons.summary: Learn how to train custom machine learning models in SageMaker.

hands_on_labs.title: Training a Custom Neural Network
hands_on_labs.goal: Implement and train a custom neural network model in SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Write a Training Script
micro_exercises.task: Write a simple training script for a linear regression model.

micro_exercises.title: Evaluate Model Performance
micro_exercises.task: Describe how to evaluate the performance of a trained model.

knowledge_check.question: What is a custom training script?
knowledge_check.answer: A script written by the user to define how a model should be trained.

knowledge_check.question: Why is model evaluation necessary?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure the model performs well on unseen data.

objectives: Understand the process of training custom models
common_mistakes: Not following best practices for coding

lessons.title: Hyperparameter Tuning
lessons.summary: Learn how to tune hyperparameters to improve model performance.

hands_on_labs.title: Tuning Hyperparameters for XGBoost
hands_on_labs.goal: Tune hyperparameters for an XGBoost model to improve its performance.

micro_exercises.title: Define Hyperparameters
micro_exercises.task: Explain what hyperparameters are and give examples.

micro_exercises.title: Tuning Methods
micro_exercises.task: List and describe two methods for hyperparameter tuning.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of hyperparameter tuning?
knowledge_check.answer: To optimize the performance of a machine learning model.

knowledge_check.question: Name one common hyperparameter for decision trees.
knowledge_check.answer: Max depth.

modules.title: Model Evaluation and Validation
modules.description: Learn how to evaluate and validate machine learning models in SageMaker.

lessons.title: Evaluation Metrics
lessons.summary: Learn about different evaluation metrics for machine learning models.

hands_on_labs.title: Calculating Evaluation Metrics
hands_on_labs.goal: Calculate and interpret evaluation metrics for a given model.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Evaluation Metrics
micro_exercises.task: List at least three evaluation metrics used in machine learning.

micro_exercises.title: Metric Significance
micro_exercises.task: Explain why precision and recall are important in classification tasks.

knowledge_check.question: What is accuracy in the context of model evaluation?
knowledge_check.answer: The ratio of correctly predicted instances to the total instances.

knowledge_check.question: Why is the F1 Score useful?
knowledge_check.answer: It balances precision and recall, providing a single metric for model performance.

real_world_use_cases: Choosing metrics for a classification problem

lessons.title: Model Validation Techniques
lessons.summary: Learn various techniques for validating machine learning models.

hands_on_labs.title: Implementing Cross-Validation
hands_on_labs.goal: Implement cross-validation on a dataset to evaluate model performance.

micro_exercises.title: Define Cross-Validation
micro_exercises.task: Explain what cross-validation is and why it is used.

micro_exercises.title: Train-Test Split
micro_exercises.task: Describe the process of splitting data into training and testing sets.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of cross-validation?
knowledge_check.answer: To assess how the results of a statistical analysis will generalize to an independent dataset.

knowledge_check.question: Why is it important to have a separate test set?
knowledge_check.answer: To evaluate the model's performance on unseen data.

common_mistakes: Using the same data for training and testing

lessons.title: Using SageMaker for Evaluation
lessons.summary: Learn how to use SageMaker tools for model evaluation.

hands_on_labs.title: Evaluating a Model in SageMaker
hands_on_labs.goal: Use SageMaker tools to evaluate a trained model.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Evaluation Tools
micro_exercises.task: List at least two evaluation tools available in SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Interpreting Results
micro_exercises.task: Explain how to interpret the results from SageMaker evaluation tools.

knowledge_check.question: What is one tool provided by SageMaker for evaluation?
knowledge_check.answer: SageMaker built-in metrics.

knowledge_check.question: Why is it important to optimize models based on evaluation results?
knowledge_check.answer: To improve model performance and ensure it meets business objectives.

real_world_use_cases: Using SageMaker to evaluate model performance

modules.title: Deploying Models in SageMaker
modules.description: Learn how to deploy machine learning models using SageMaker.

lessons.title: Deployment Options
lessons.summary: Learn about different deployment options available in SageMaker.

hands_on_labs.title: Deploying a Real-Time Endpoint
hands_on_labs.goal: Deploy a trained model as a real-time endpoint in SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Deployment Options
micro_exercises.task: List at least three deployment options available in SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Use Case Matching
micro_exercises.task: Match deployment options to their appropriate use cases.

knowledge_check.question: What is a real-time endpoint in SageMaker?
knowledge_check.answer: A service that allows you to make predictions in real-time using a deployed model.

knowledge_check.question: Why is batch transform useful?
knowledge_check.answer: It allows for processing large datasets in a single request.

real_world_use_cases: Deploying a model for real-time predictions
Using batch transform for large datasets

lessons.title: Deploying with SageMaker Pipelines
lessons.summary: Learn how to use SageMaker Pipelines for model deployment.

hands_on_labs.title: Creating a Deployment Pipeline
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a SageMaker Pipeline for automating model deployment.

micro_exercises.title: Define Pipeline Steps
micro_exercises.task: List the steps involved in creating a SageMaker Pipeline.

micro_exercises.title: Automation Benefits
micro_exercises.task: Explain the benefits of automating deployment processes.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of SageMaker Pipelines?
knowledge_check.answer: To automate and manage end-to-end machine learning workflows.

knowledge_check.question: Why is monitoring important in deployment?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure the deployed model is performing as expected and to catch issues early.

lessons.title: Monitoring Deployed Models
lessons.summary: Learn how to monitor and manage deployed models in SageMaker.

hands_on_labs.title: Setting Up Monitoring for a Deployed Model
hands_on_labs.goal: Implement monitoring for a deployed model in SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Monitoring Tools
micro_exercises.task: List at least two monitoring tools available in SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Performance Evaluation
micro_exercises.task: Describe how to evaluate the performance of a deployed model.

knowledge_check.question: What is one monitoring tool provided by SageMaker?
knowledge_check.answer: Amazon CloudWatch.

knowledge_check.question: Why is it important to monitor deployed models?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure they continue to perform well and to detect any issues early.

real_world_use_cases: Setting up alerts for model drift

modules.title: Capstone Project
modules.description: A comprehensive project that integrates all learned concepts in AWS SageMaker.
module_outcomes: Apply all learned skills in a real-world scenario
Build, train, and deploy a machine learning model

lessons.title: Capstone Project Overview
lessons.summary: Introduction to the capstone project and its objectives.

hands_on_labs.title: Project Planning
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a project plan outlining objectives and timelines.

micro_exercises.title: Define Project Objectives
micro_exercises.task: List the objectives for your capstone project.

micro_exercises.title: Scope Definition
micro_exercises.task: Define the scope of your project including what will and won't be included.

knowledge_check.question: What is the first step in planning a project?
knowledge_check.answer: Defining clear objectives.

knowledge_check.question: Why is timeline planning important?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure the project stays on track and meets deadlines.

lessons.title: Building the Model
lessons.summary: Learn how to build and train the machine learning model for the project.

hands_on_labs.title: Building and Training the Model
hands_on_labs.goal: Build and train a machine learning model using SageMaker.

micro_exercises.title: Model Building Steps
micro_exercises.task: List the steps involved in building a machine learning model.

micro_exercises.title: Initial Performance Evaluation
micro_exercises.task: Describe how to evaluate the initial performance of your model.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of training a model?
knowledge_check.answer: To enable the model to learn from data and make predictions.

knowledge_check.question: Why is performance evaluation important during training?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure the model is learning effectively and to make necessary adjustments.

objectives: Train the model with prepared data

lessons.title: Deploying and Evaluating the Model
lessons.summary: Learn how to deploy the trained model and evaluate its performance.

hands_on_labs.title: Deploying the Model
hands_on_labs.goal: Deploy the trained model and evaluate its performance.

micro_exercises.title: Deployment Steps
micro_exercises.task: List the steps involved in deploying a machine learning model.

micro_exercises.title: Post-Deployment Evaluation
micro_exercises.task: Describe how to evaluate the performance of a deployed model.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of deploying a model?
knowledge_check.answer: To make the model available for predictions in a production environment.

knowledge_check.question: Why is post-deployment evaluation important?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure the model continues to perform well and meets user needs.

real_world_use_cases: Deploying a model for production use

capstone.title: Capstone Project Title
capstone.description: A comprehensive project that integrates all learned concepts in AWS SageMaker.
deliverables: Build and train a machine learning model
